div.head: ☞ An exhortacion to the diligent studye of the holy scripture gathered out of the Bible
div.p: Christ vnto the people. Iohn̄ .v. Serche the scriptures: for they are they that testifye of me.

Paul to Timothy, ii. Tim .iii. Al scripture gyuen by inspiracion of God is profitable to teache, to improue, to amend and to instruct in ryghtousnesse, that the mā of God maye be perfecte and prepared to al good workes.
The same to the Rom .xv. What thynges so euer are wrytten, • re wrytten for our lernynge: that we thorowe pacience and comfort of ye scriptures, might haue hope.
Salomon Prou .xxx. All the worde of God, is pure and cleane it is a shyld vnto them that put their trust in it. Put nothinge vnto his wordes, lest he reproue the, and thou be found a lyar.

Moses to the people. Deu .xii. Ye shall not doo euerye man what semeth hym good in his owne eyes: But what soeuer I commaunde you that take hede ye doo, and put nought thervnto, neither take ought therefrom.

The Lord vnto Iosua. Ios .l. Let not the boke of this lawe departe oute of thy mouth: But recorde therin daye and nyghte, that thou mayste be circumspecte to doo accordynge to all that is wrytten therin. For then shalte thou make thy waye prosperous, and then shalte thou haue vnderstandynge. Turne there from neyther to the ryght hande, ne to the lefte: that thou mayst haue vnderstandynge in all that thou takest in hande.

The same to the people. Exo .xiii. And thou shalte shewe thy sonne at that tyme, saying: This is done bycause of that whiche the Lorde dyd vnto mē when I came oute of Egypte. Therfore it shall be a signe vnto the vpon thyne hande. and a remembraunce bytwene thyne eyes, that the Lordes lawe maye be in thy mouthe. For with a stronge hande the Lorde brought the oute of Egypte.

Moses Deut .xxxi. Se that thou rede this lawe before all Israeli in theyr eares. Gather the people togyther: bothe men, women and chyldren, and the straūgers that are in the cities: that they maye heare, lerne, and feare the Lorde youre God, to kepe all the wordes of this lawe.
